awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Presidential Young Investigator Award
awd_abstract_narration: The achievements and the promise in research of Professor                  Greg W. Anderson of the University of Minnesota have been                       recognized in a Presidential Young Investigator award. This award               will further support the work that Dr. Anderson has been con-                   ducting in number theory and the arithmetic aspects of positive-                characteristic algebraic geometry, especially the theory of                     Drinfeld modules.                                                                    This research is in the mathematical area of the algebraic                 geometry of positive characteristic. Although the field of                      algebraic geometry originated with notions of continuously                      varying geometric structures like lines and planes, in this                     context the discrete takes over, and methods akin to those from                 the theory of whole numbers are most useful. Reciprocally, the                  algebraic geometry of positive characteristic is now having great               influence on the Theory of Numbers, and is finding application in               Computer Science and Coding Theory.
